DOC.brief_title: Does Cryofixation Skin Specimens Affect Quality Subsequent Formalin Fixed Paraffin Embedded H E Histology
DOC.detailed_description: Generating formalin fix paraffin embed ( FFPE ) hematoxylin eosin ( H & E ) stain permanent section previously cryofixed tissue common practice use confirm diagnosis frozen section histology . In dermatology , practice use examine Mohs layer debulk well routine nonmelanoma skin cancer ( NMSC ) biopsies initial histologic diagnosis frozen section . Even though freeze tissue introduce histologic artifact , study document whether occurs specifically cryofixed tissue subsequently thaw permanent FFPE H & E histology . The purpose study determine whether freeze-thaw process use generate permanent section cryofixation introduces significantly detectable histologic difference compare permanent section previously cryofixed . Thirty debulk specimens basal cell squamous cell carcinoma prospectively collect . Each specimen split half process cryofixed permanent half noncryofixed permanent . The investigator show slide random order group four blind participant ( two dermatopathologists two Mohs surgeon ) . Each participant must first rate overall quality histology . Then , participant rate slide quality cellular morphology , nuclear morphology , color contrast stain , intactness specimen , miscellaneous artifact . These data analyze statistical significance .
